DataElement.preferredName: Conventional Imaging Anatomic Site Recurrent Tumor Core Lab Image Submission Timepoint Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the timepoint when conventional images for recurrent tumor of named location(s) within the body are submitted to the imaging core lab.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Conventional Imaging Anatomic Site Recurrent Neoplasm Imaging Core Lab Image Submission Timepoint Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging using computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging, or ultrasound._Named locations of or within the body._The reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission._A shared facility for imaging services._Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging using computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging, or ultrasound.

Concepts.definition: Imaging using computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging, or ultrasound.

Property.preferredName: Anatomic Site Recurrent Neoplasm Imaging Core Lab Image Submission Timepoint Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body.:The reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission.:A shared facility for imaging services.:Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.
The reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission.
A shared facility for imaging services.
Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was the patient's conventiona
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the patient's conventional chest abdomen and pelvis CT images demonstrating recurrent tumor submitted within 21 days from acquisition to the ACR Core Lab?
